title.rendered: Nepal vs Scotland, CWC League 2: Pitch Report, Fantasy Team, Probable Playing XIs & Fantasy Tips

content.rendered:
Pitch Report for Nepal vs Scotland, CWC League 2019-23

Venue: Tribhuvan University International Cricket Ground, Kirtipur

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 256

2nd innings average score: 255

Wickets per innings: 8

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Team for Nepal vs Scotland

We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable Playing XIs

Nepal: Aasif Sheikh (wk), Kushal Bhurtel, Gyanendra Malla, Rohit Paudel (c), Kushal Malla, Sundeep Jora, Dipendra Singh Airee, Gulsan Jha, Sompal Kami, Karan KC, Sandeep Lamichhane

Scotland: Kyle Coetzer, George Munsey, Christopher McBride, Richie Berrington (c), Matthew Cross (wk), Brandon McMullen, Michael Leask, Chris Greaves, Mark Watt, Safyaan Sharif, Hamza Tahir

Also Read:

UAE vs Namibia, CWC Fantasy Tips

Multan vs Karachi, Pakistan T20 League 2023 Fantasy Tips

Quetta vs Lahore, Pakistan T20 League 2023 Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Scotland batters struggled against Dipendra Singh Airee and Sandeep Lamichhane in the past. Dipendra has scalped four wickets at a strike rate of 21, while Lamichhane has picked up eight wickets in just three matches.

Mark Watt has done serious damage against Nepal, picking up 10 wickets in five matches. He is in scintillating form too – 17 wickets in the last six matches.

Michael Leask averages 33 since 2021. Interestingly, his only century came against Nepal. In addition, he has been providing handy points with the ball too,  bagging 17 wickets in 12 outings.

George Munsey has been in great form of late. His last three scores read 51, 45, and 103*.

Christopher McBride made it to the Best11 in three of the last five matches, during which he averaged 42 with the bat and took a wicket.

Safyaan Mohammed Sharif has gone wicketless just once in the last eight matches.

Karan KC and Sompal Kami both average 25 with the ball since 2022. Between them, they have taken 65 wickets.

In the only game Kushal Malla played against Scotland, he smashed 81 off 67 and picked two wickets.

Richie Berrington has collected only 41 runs in five ODIs against Nepal.

A bowler has picked a three-wicket haul as many as eight times in the last three matches at the venue.
